app package¶

Submodules¶

app.models module¶

Object oriented representation of our data base structure. We will have 4 intervened entities: elements, periods, groups and trivias

class app.models.Element(**kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Represents an element on the period table. Eg: Hydrogen, Nitrogen, etc.

class app.models.Group(**kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Represents a group in the period table. For example alkali metals, alkaline metals, etc.

class app.models.Image(**kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Represents an image. They will be used through out the website, so they will have forein keys for each of our 3 primary data tables (Elements, Groups and Periods)

class app.models.Period(**kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Represents a period in the period table. A period can be though of the row number in the period table

class app.models.Trivia(**kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Represents a Trivia or cool snippet of information about an element, group or period. For example did you know hydrogen is made in the sun?
